member.param: Task that will not be awaited.
[Optional] Action called within finally clause, null or unspecified means no finally action
Do not provide. Compiler provided name of method calling this method.
Do not provide. Compiler provided name of file calling this method.
Do not provide. Compiler provided name of line calling this method.

member.summary: The function wraps the async function in a try catch. In the catch it throws a new exception that provides the Name, file and line number of the function call this NonAwait function. It add the caught exception in the inner exception. When specified, the afterwards action is called with a finally clause.
member.param: Function returning a Task.
[Optional] Action called within finally clause, null or unspecified means no finally action

Do not provide. Compiler provided name of file calling this method.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.CommonControls.DoubleUtil.AreClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: AreClose - Returns whether or not two doubles are "close". That is, whether or not they are within epsilon of each other. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: bool - the result of the AreClose comparision.
member.param: The first double to compare.
The second double to compare.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.CommonControls.DoubleUtil.LessThan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: LessThan - Returns whether or not the first double is less than the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly less than *and* not within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: bool - the result of the LessThan comparision.
member.param: The first double to compare.
The second double to compare.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.CommonControls.DoubleUtil.GreaterThan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: GreaterThan - Returns whether or not the first double is greater than the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly greater than *and* not within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: bool - the result of the GreaterThan comparision.
member.param: The first double to compare.
The second double to compare.

Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: bool - the result of the LessThanOrClose comparision.
member.param: The first double to compare.
The second double to compare.

Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.CommonControls.LayoutRoundingUtil.RoundLayoutValue(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the value to be used for layout rounding at high DPI.
member.param: Input value to be rounded.
Ratio of screen's DPI to layout DPI
member.returns: Adjusted value that will produce layout rounding on screen at high dpi.
member.remarks: This is a layout helper method. It takes DPI into account and also does not return the rounded value if it is unacceptable for layout, e.g. Infinity or NaN. It's a helper associated with UseLayoutRounding property and should not be used as a general rounding utility.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.CommonControls.VirtualizingWrapPanel
member.summary:
A WrapPanel supporting virtualization mostly based on the .NET implementation of VirtualizingStackPanel. The VirtualizingWrapPanel currently only supports showing grouped items with Orientation set to Vertical. The panel notably doesn't support yet: - Horitonzal orientation - Item scrolling (VirtualizingPanel.ScrollUnit set to Item instead of the default Pixel) - No grouping making this panel directly the scrolling host - Not holding a collections of items (but rather a set fo fixed elements declared in XAML) // Very rare scenario
Potential performance improvement: Most of the logic of this panel is currently going through all the items on by one as the VirtualizingStackPanel does. Switching to a logic line by line would notably reduce the number of calls and calculations (This is already done in part of the Arrange logic).
Potential smaller optimization: in theory, because the UI elements are not processed/handled in parallel, we could make all the reflection helpers static rather than creating them for each VirtualizingWrapPanel instance.
Potential smaller optimization to time: replace (through reflection with delegate) all the calls to InsertInternalChild, AddInternalChild and RemoveInternalChildRange to internal overloads taking the collection as argument to by-pass unecessary internal tests and validation. This would however expose us even more to a potential signature change in a reflected method.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.CommonControls.VirtualizingWrapPanel.StretchItems
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies if the items get stretched to fill up remaining space. The default value is false.
member.remarks: The MaxWidth and MaxHeight properties of the ItemContainerStyle can be used to limit the stretching. In this case the use of the remaining space will be determined by the SpacingMode property.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.CommonControls.VirtualizingWrapPanel.ItemWidth
member.summary: The ItemWidth and ItemHeight properties specify the size of all items in the WrapPanel. Note that children of WrapPanel may have their own Width/Height properties set - the ItemWidth/ItemHeight specifies the size of "layout partition" reserved by WrapPanel for the child. If this property is not set (or set to "Auto" in markup or Double.NaN in code) - the size of layout partition is equal to DesiredSize of the child element.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.CommonControls.VirtualizingWrapPanel.ItemHeight
member.summary: The ItemWidth and ItemHeight properties specify the size of all items in the WrapPanel. Note that children of WrapPanel may have their own Width/Height properties set - the ItemWidth/ItemHeight specifies the size of "layout partition" reserved by WrapPanel for the child. If this property is not set (or set to "Auto" in markup or Double.NaN in code) - the size of layout partition is equal to DesiredSize of the child element.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.CommonControls.VirtualizingWrapPanel.AdjustFirstVisibleChildIndex(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called after 'count' items were removed or recycled from the Generator. _firstItemInExtendedViewportChildIndex is the index of the first visible container. This index isn't exactly the child position in the UIElement collection; it's actually the index of the realized container inside the generator. Since we've just removed some realized containers from the generator (by calling Remove or Recycle), we have to adjust the first visible child index.

number of items removed

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.CommonControls.VirtualizingWrapPanel.InvalidateMeasureOnItemsHost(System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IHierarchicalVirtualizationAndScrollInfo)
member.summary: Called when a new viewport is set on the child and it is about to be measured. Invalidates Measure on all elements between child.ItemsHost and this panel. Note: this will only be called in the scenario where this panel is hosting inner panels

After a measure pass, compute the effective offset - taking into account changes to the average container size discovered during measure. This is the inverse of the previous method - ComputeFirstItemInViewportIndexAndOffset - in the sense that it produces an offset that, if fed back into that method (with the revised average container sizes), will yield the same result obtained in the current measure pass. That is, the same item will be selected as the first item, and likewise for its sub-items.

DesiredSize is normally computed by summing up the size of all items we've generated. Pixel-based virtualization uses a 'full' desired size. This extends the given desired size beyond the visible items. It will extend it by the items before or after the set of generated items. The given pivotIndex is the index of either the first or last item generated.
Extends the viewport to include the cacheSizeBeforeViewport and cacheSizeAfterViewport.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Ribbon.BookmarksGalleryViewModelBase.UpdateGalleryLayout(ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.GalleryItem)
member.summary: Update the gallery layout when the gallery items are loaded: (1) Precisely allocate horizontal space to the gallery's ScrollViewerItemsPresenter and wrap panels in there accounting for indentation and horizontal arrangement (items per row). (2) Disable all non-content gallery items (not of type BookmarkGalleryItemType.Content) so that they are not selectable and not highlighted when hovered over. (3) Clear the min and max width bindings on the ScrollViewer to let the content (within the ScrollViewerItemsPresenter) determines its size. (4) Specifiy the min and max width for folder name and border items because they may break the wrap panel layout if left unspecified. (5) Allocate additional space to the gallery scroll view to account for the vertical scroll bar.
member.param: GalleryItem

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Ribbon.LayerComboBox
member.summary: A layer combo box meant to be used on the ribbon. It is created when it's first made visible, and then lives for the rest of the Pro session. It always references the active map. It's a different implementation from the layer control used on panes and dialogs; this one is better-suited to work in the DAML framework.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Ribbon.LayerComboBox.GetSelectedLayer
member.summary: Gets the selection from the derived class. It is invoked: 1. when the combo box is constructed 2. when the active map changes, 3. when the combo box is empty and new layers are added 4. when the selected layer is removed from the map, and a new selection is needed.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Ribbon.LayerComboBox.SetSelectedLayerAsync(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Layer)

member.summary: Converts source values to a value for the binding target. The data binding engine calls this method when it propagates the values from source bindings to the binding target.
member.param: The array of values that the source bindings in the produces. The value indicates that the source binding has no value to provide for conversion.
The type of the binding target property.
The converter parameter to use.
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: A converted value.If the method returns , the valid value is used.A return value of . indicates that the converter did not produce a value, and that the binding will use the if it is available, or else will use the default value.A return value of . indicates that the binding does not transfer the value or use the or the default value.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.MultiBoolAndToVisibilityConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type[],System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts a binding target value to the source binding values.
member.param: The value that the binding target produces.
The array of types to convert to. The array length indicates the number and types of values that are suggested for the method to return.
The converter parameter to use.
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: An array of values that have been converted from the target value back to the source values.

member.summary: Add an overlay graphic to the map view. This is only supported in 2D.

member.returns: An object that when disposed will remove the overlay.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.MapControlView.AddOverlay(ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.Geometry,ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMSymbolReference,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Add an overlay graphic to the map view.
member.param: The geometry of the overlay.
The symbol to use for the overlay.
Map reference scale or -1

Visibility factor for showing the overlay through other objects when obscured in 3D.
Valid range is [0..1], any other value will be treated as 0 (not visible).
member.remarks: When the referenceScale is not equal to -1, the overlay will be created in real world units relative to the provided map reference scale (referenceScale). Otherwise, the overlay will be created in units of points. This is only supported in 2D.
member.returns: An object that when disposed will remove the overlay.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.MapControlView.MapToClient(ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.MapPoint)
member.summary: Converts a point in the coordinates of the map or scene to a point in client coordinates relative to the top-left corner of the view. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.param: The point that represents coordinates in a map.
member.returns: The converted point in client coordinates relative to the top-left corner of the view.
member.exception: This method or property must be called within the lambda passed to QueuedTask.Run.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.QueryBuilder.QueryBuilderComboBox
member.summary:
Follow steps 1a or 1b and then 2 to use this custom control in a XAML file.
Step 1a) Using this custom control in a XAML file that exists in the current project. Add this XmlNamespace attribute to the root element of the markup file where it is to be used:
xmlns:MyNamespace="clr-namespace:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.QueryBuilder"
Step 1b) Using this custom control in a XAML file that exists in a different project. Add this XmlNamespace attribute to the root element of the markup file where it is to be used:
xmlns:MyNamespace="clr-namespace:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.QueryBuilder;assembly=ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.QueryBuilder"
You will also need to add a project reference from the project where the XAML file lives to this project and Rebuild to avoid compilation errors:
Right click on the target project in the Solution Explorer and "Add Reference"->"Projects"->[Browse to and select this project]
Step 2) Go ahead and use your control in the XAML file.
<MyNamespace:QueryBuilderComboBox/>
Step 3) Provide an UIElement for the PopupContent. The contents of the ComboBox and be displayed in a ScrollViewer or an ItemsControl found in the UIElement.
To use a ScrollViewer, name it in the UIElement and set the PopupScrollViewerName property of the ComboBox to the same name. NOTE: CURRENTLY SETTING THE SCROLLVIEWER WILL CAUSE VIRTUALIZATION WITH A VIRTUALIZINGSTACKPANEL TO FAIL!
To use a ItemsControl, name it in the UIElement and set the PopupItemsControlName property of the ComboBox to the same name.
If both items are provided the ScrollViewer will be used.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.QueryBuilder.QueryBuilderSqlSyntax.SetProperties(ServiceContracts.FlavorSQLSyntax)
member.summary: Constructor that accepts flavor-only SQL syntax metadata.

member.summary: Flag indicating the mouse button is not pressed.

member.summary: Keys that should ignored, when the mouse down is received. When the keys are active the navigation action will not start.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.ViewerMouseAction.IsActive
member.summary: Flag indicating that the current action is actively listening to events. This is the case from the call to start and the execution of the action has been completed.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.ViewerMouseAction.IsTimerActive
member.summary: Flag indicating the timer is active.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.ViewerMouseAction.Start(ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Win32.POINT)
member.summary:
Function called when we want to start listening to mouse events and we want to start our action.
This function is called by the ExploreNavigation when it received a mouse down message.
If the action is a timed action, a timer will be started. The duration of the timer will be the double click system time. If the timer fires, then the action will be executed. If the Stop function is called, the timer will be aborted.
member.param: Click location at start of action.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.ViewerMouseAction.Stop(System.Int32)
member.summary:
This function is used to cancel the mouse down action.
This function is called by the ExploreNavigation when it receives a mouse move or double click message.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.ViewerMouseAction.ButtonUp(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function is called by the ExploreNavigation when it receives a mouse up message.
member.param: State of the keyboard.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.ViewerMouseAction.Execute
member.summary:
Function called to execute the mouse down action.
Called from the action timer or from the ButtonUp function.
member.returns: true - The action was executed. false - The action was not executed.

This property can potentially return a invalid /not hydrated struct. There are 2 distinct workflows which required it. 1. Loading a persisted set of Attribute rules 2. Adding a new Reviewer rule.
Both the above workflows have been handled correctly to hydrate this property. The correct implementation woudl be to chance Add Rule workfow to construct and initialize Async for supportin async initialization. This is a TODO for later release.

Area's part error 112 - Part's Area is under minimum 113 - Part's Area is equal to or under minimum 114 - Part's Area is over maximum 115 - Part's Area is equal to or over maximum 116 - Part's Area is within an excluded range 117 - Part's Area is within an excluded range or equal to its bounds 118 - Part's Area is outside the acceptable range 119 - Part's Area is outside the acceptable or equal to its bounds 120 - Part's Area is equal to an excluded value 121 - Part's Area is not equal to the acceptable value

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.DesignView.AttributeRules.MonotonicityRuleViewModel.EvaluationType

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.DesignView.AttributeRules.MonotonicityRuleViewModel.NonMonotonicValuesAreError
member.summary: Boolean value indicating if a feature should be returned as validation result when it's vertices are not strictly increasing or decreasing in value. The From node of the feature is used as the point of reference when comparing vertex values. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.DesignView.AttributeRules.MonotonicityRuleViewModel.LevelValuesAreError
member.summary: Boolean value indicating if a feature should be returned as validation result when it's From node is equal to the To node. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.DesignView.AttributeRules.MonotonicityRuleViewModel.MonotonicityDirection
member.summary: Boolean value indicating if a feature should be returned as validation result when it's vertices are not strictly increasing or decreasing in value. The From node of the feature is used as the point of reference when comparing vertex values. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.DesignView.AttributeRules.MonotonicityRuleViewModel.EnableZOption

member.summary: Boolean value indicating if M option is enabled/disabled. This is used as trigger to disable/enable behavior as we can only test a M or Z value for a check

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.DesignView.AttributeRules.MonotonicityRuleViewModel.SetErrorDescriptionAndNumber
member.summary:
Method to set error description and code based on user selected values. Possible error number and messages
Z: 800, Non-monotonic Z value, Z-values are non-monotonic. 801, Constant Z value, From/To Z-values are equal. 802, Increasing Z value, From/To Z-values are increasing. 803, Decreasing Z value, From/To Z-values are decreasing. 804, Non-monotonic and Constant Z value, Z-values are non-monotonic and From/To Z-values are equal. 805, Non-monotonic and Increasing Z value, Z-values are non-monotonic and From/To Z-values are increasing. 806, Non-monotonic and Decreasing Z value, Z-values are non-monotonic and From/To Z-values are decreasing.
M: 807, Non-monotonic M value, M-values are non-monotonic. ?? 808, No measure (NaN) value, M-values contain no measure (NaN). ?? 809, Non-monotonic M value and no measure (NaN) value, M-values are non-monotonic and contain no measure (NaN). 810, Constant M value, From/To M-values are equal. 811, Increasing M value, From/To M-values are increasing. 812, Decreasing M value, From/To M-values are decreasing. 813, Non-monotonic and Constant M value, M-values are non-monotonic and From/To M-values are equal. 814, Non-monotonic and Increasing M value, M-values are non-monotonic and From/To M-values are increasing. 815, Non-monotonic and Decreasing M value, M-values are non-monotonic and From/To M-values are decreasing. ?? 816, No measure (NaN) value and Constant M value, M-values contain no measure (NaN) and From/To M-values are equal. ?? 817, No measure (NaN) value and Increasing M value, M-values contain no measure (NaN) and From/To M-values are increasing. ?? 818, No measure (NaN) value and Decreasing M value, M-values contain no measure (NaN) and From/To M-values are decreasing. ?? 819, Non-monotonic and No measure (NaN) value and Constant M value, M-values are non-monotonic and M-values contain no measure (NaN) and From/To M-values are equal. ?? 820, Non-monotonic and No measure (NaN) value and Increasing M value, M-values are non-monotonic and M-values contain no measure (NaN) and From/To M-values are increasing. ?? 821, Non-monotonic and No measure (NaN) value and Decreasing M value, M-values are non-monotonic and M-values contain no measure (NaN) and From/To M-values are decreasing.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.DesignView.AttributeRules.RevUtils.ConvertToleranceByUnits(ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.Unit,System.Double,ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.Unit)
member.summary:
Convert from to .
In addition to the standard conversion linear-to-linear units, this method converts angular-angular and angular-linear units.
Do not use this method to convert large distance angular-linear units.
To convert to linear-angle units, it is assumed that
6370996.8818298066 meters to 1 rad, or
111194.87222222223 meters to 1 degree
member.param: Distance in
member.returns: Converted from to .

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Views.PropertyPage.LayerPropertiesManager
member.summary:
LayerPropertiesManager stores the layer definition of all layers for which the user has opened the property page.
Individual property pages must use the LayerPropertiesManager to get the layer definition(s) they need during initialization, and during commit update any needed properties and set LayerDefinitionModified to true.
Individual property pages must never store a local copy of the layer definition nor must they call any native methods that update the layer definition during commit

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Views.PropertyPage.MapPropertiesManager
member.summary:
MapPropertiesManager stores the map definition of all maps for which the user has opened the property page.
Individual property pages must use the MapPropertiesManager to get the map definition(s) they need during initialization, and during commit update any needed properties and set MapDefinitionModified to true.
Individual property pages must never store a local copy of the map definition nor must they call any native methods that update the map definition during commit

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Operations.UpdateAggregationTypeOperation
member.summary: An operation for changing the aggregation type on a feature layer.
member.remarks:
Has special handling for binning (database or client-side), which is such a wholesale change that we have to use the "update layer definition" service instead of "update aggregation type".
Also handles refreshing associated pane states. Since this operation doesn't change TOC selection, the usual MapTOC mechanism for refreshing pane state doesn't happen automatically.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Operations.UpdateMapMemberOperation._allowList
member.summary: The properties that can be changed in post-facto mode. We could probably support many more. These are just the ones we've tested.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Operations.UpdateMapMemberOperation.QualifiesPostFacto(ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.LayerProperty[])
member.summary: Returns true if these changes qualify for a post-facto operation. This should be called before invoking the constructor.
member.remarks: Only certain, relatively simple changes can be safely undone this way.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Operations.UpdateMapMemberOperation.#ctor(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Map,System.String[],ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.LayerProperty[],System.Object[])
member.summary: Constructor for the "post-facto" case. QualifiesPostFacto should be checked before calling this constructor.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Operations.UpdateMapMemberOperation.AddPostFactoChanges(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Map,System.String[],ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.LayerProperty[],System.Object[])
member.summary: Checks the sync collections for additional changes made in native code, and adds them to the operation so they're processed during undo. QualifiesPostFacto should be checked before calling this function.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Properties.Settings.GetSettingFromUserConfigAndAdminSetting``1(System.Nullable{``0},ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Framework.AdministratorSetting{``0},``0)
member.summary: Calculates the setting value that should be used when provided with the user.config's setting value and the administrator setting (or null if it isn't set). The enables the administrator setting to provide a default value if the user hasn't set the setting yet. The user.config setting must be a nullable type to allow for an unset (null) value.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.LocalResources.SymbolRes.AnimationDuration
member.summary: How many seconds for the glTF file to play through its entire animation. We start with the glTF file's authored duration, but users can reduce this value to speed up the animation or increase to slow down the animation. This is designed as an editable combobox so that the default value is stored in the dropdown in case users want to get back to it.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.LocalResources.SymbolRes.AnimationEndingDuration
member.summary: Only shown for time-aware layers. This works like Duration, but informs GFX of the terminating speed of a time-aware feature so that they can interpolate between Duration and Ending Duration. The label and field are only enabled when the checkbox is checked.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.ManagedLayerProperties
member.summary: This class is used by native service callback methods for layers and stanalone tables. The class serializes xml from the native tier to managed CIM objects. We are using this class so that we can do the serialization on the worker thread, before invoking back to the UI thread to complete the callback.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Identify.InfoWindowViewModel.OnLayerRemoved(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Layer)
member.summary: Update pop-up tree when a layer is remove from TOC: (1) if the layer is associated with a layer node in the pop-up tree, remove the layer node and all its child nodes, and close the pop-up window if this is the only layer node in the pop-up tree. (2) if the layer node is associated with a relate layer node in the pop-up tree, do not remove the relate layer node but disable the zoom/pan/select commands in the context menu for all its child nodes.
member.param: Layer
member.returns: Items removed

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Events.ElementSelectionChangedEvent
member.summary: Occurs when an element selection changes on a layout or graphics layer
member.remarks:
ElementSelectionChangedEvent is also fired whenever a view first initializes.
Reference to get a list of arguments. Element selections can change on a layout or on graphics layers. Selections only change when the view displaying the layout or graphics layer(s) has been initialized.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.ScalesHelper.ToCIM(System.Double,System.Boolean,ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Core.LinearDisplayUnit,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Converts a Managed Scale or Height to CIM value.
On the managed side, unused scale/height levels are stored as NaN whereas in the CIM they are stored as -1. Also on the managed side, 3D distance is shown in default linear units whereas in the CIM they are stored as meters.
member.param: Scale or height to convert
It's a Scale for 2D maps.
The display unit for 3D heights.
Allow negative values
member.returns: The CIM value for the Scale or Height.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.ScalesHelper.ToCIMScale(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Convert Managed Scale to CIM value.
On the managed side, unused scale/height levels are stored as NaN whereas in the CIM they are stored as -1. Also on the managed side, 3D distance is shown in default linear units whereas in the CIM they are stored as meters.
member.param: Scale or height to convert
Allow negative values
member.returns: The CIM value for the Scale or Height.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.ScalesHelper.ToCIMHeight(System.Double,ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Core.LinearDisplayUnit,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Convert Managed 3D Height to CIM value.
On the managed side, unused scale/height levels are stored as NaN whereas in the CIM they are stored as -1. Also on the managed side, 3D distance is shown in default linear units whereas in the CIM they are stored as meters.
member.param: Scale or height to convert
The display unit for 3D heights.
Allow negative values
member.returns: The CIM value for the Scale or Height.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.ScalesHelper.FromCIMScale(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Convert a CIM scale to a managed value.
On the managed side, unused scale/height levels are stored as NaN whereas in the CIM they are stored as -1. Also on the managed side, 3D distance is shown in default linear units whereas in the CIM they are stored as meters.
member.param: CIM Scale to convert.
Allow negative for conversion.
member.returns: A managed scale value

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.ScalesHelper.FromCIMHeight(System.Double,ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Core.LinearDisplayUnit,System.Boolean)

Convert a CIM height to a managed value.
On the managed side, unused scale/height levels are stored as NaN whereas in the CIM they are stored as -1. Also on the managed side, 3D distance is shown in default linear units whereas in the CIM they are stored as meters.
member.param: Height to convert.
Linear display unit to convert from.
Allow negative for conversion.
member.returns: A managed height value

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Symbology.DropDownColorPicker.ForceEyeDropperToolToHideProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets if the eye dropper tool is forced to hide.
member.remarks:
The color picker must be hosted on a non-modal dialog such as a dockpane in order for the Eye Dropper tool to be able to be used. Set this property to true when you are specifically wanting to hide the Eye Dropper tool on the color picker; for example on your own custom ProWindow that is displayed in a modal fashion.
Note, the application may hide the Eye Dropper tool by default in some scenarios. For example the tool will not be visible if the color picker is on a propertySheet.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Symbology.DropDownColorPicker.ForceEyeDropperToolToHide
member.summary: Gets or sets if the eye dropper tool is forced to hide.

The color picker must be hosted on a non-modal dialog such as a dockpane in order for the Eye Dropper tool to be able to be used. Set this property to true when you are specifically wanting to hide the Eye Dropper tool on the color picker; for example on your own custom ProWindow that is displayed in a modal fashion.
Note, the application may hide the Eye Dropper tool by default in some scenarios. For example the tool will not be visible if the color picker is on a propertySheet.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Symbology.HeatMapSymbolizerViewModel.Field
member.summary: Name of the field denoting weighting values for each feature. The field's value is the count or quantity to be spread across the landscape to create a continuous surface. Values in the field may be integer or floating point. The options for the field are listed below. Specify the name of a numeric field in the feature table. Use "" if no item or special value will be used and each feature will be counted once. Use Shape if input features contains Z.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Symbology.HeatMapSymbolizerViewModel.Radius
member.summary: Controls how far the heat spreads away from the points. Specified and stored in Points and translates to Pixels at draw time.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Symbology.GridSplitterMaxHeightConverter
member.summary: This converter adds the returns the result of value+parameter, where both objects are assumed to be doubles. This converter is used to update DataRow.MaxHeight when a Grid Splitter is used. When the DataRow.MaxHeight is not limited it is possible to drag the Grid Splitter control out of view, thus loosing the capability to resize the grid as the Grid Splitter is not available.

member.summary: Gets / sets if this tag should be removed while it's contents are preserved.

member.summary: Gets / sets to which name this tag should be renamed. Set to null to not rename the tag.

member.summary: Gets / sets the operation to be performed on the tag if it does not have any attributes.

member.summary: Sets which attributes should have their value set or overridden. Attribute name as key, value to set as value.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Popups.Html.HtmlSanitizerTagRule.CheckAttributes
member.summary: Sets which checks to perform on which attributes. Attribute name as key, check type as value.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Popups.Html.HtmlSanitizerTagRule.RemoveEmpty
member.summary: Gets / sets if empty instances of this tag should be removed.

member.summary: Default operation. Does nothing.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Popups.Html.SanitizerOperation.FlattenTag
member.summary: Strip the tag while preserving it's contents.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Popups.Html.SanitizerOperation.RemoveTag
member.summary: Completely remove the tag and it's contents.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Popups.Html.SanitizerOperation.RemoveAttribute
member.summary: Removes only the attribute while preserving the tag itself.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Popups.Pages.WrapPanelRightDockingMarginConverter
member.summary: Per design, the last button (from left to right) "Reset" needs to be docked to the right. As a WrapPanel is not able to keep a child docked to the right, a custom margin converter was created to calculate the margin for the last button, so that: Case 1: if there is not enough horizontal space to keep all buttons in a single row and additional rows are expected, return the default margin so the first buttons of all rows in the WrapPanel are left aligned. Case 2: otherwise, allocate all unused horizontal space to the left margin so the last child will be docked to the right.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.TOC.Categories.DataSourceCategory.GetSimplifiedPath
member.summary:
Gets a URL, path, or subset of a connection string for the data source.
Returns a containing the simple path.
Examples:
Enterprise geodatabase: "SERVER=EXAMPLE;INSTANCE=gdb:sqlserver:EXAMPLE;DBCLIENT=sqlserver;DB_CONNECTION_PROPERTIES=EXAMPLE; DATABASE=db1;USER=gdb;AUTHENTICATION_MODE=DBMS"
Mobile geodatabase: "C:\Example\example.geodatabase"
Feature service: "https://gis.example.com/server/rest/services/Example/FeatureServer"
File geodatabase, shapefile, Excel file, etc.: "C:\Example\example.gdb"
Cloud data warehouse: "SERVER=EXAMPLE;INSTANCE="sde:redshift$Server=example.redshift.amazonaws.com;Port=123;Database=db1"; DBCLIENT=redshift;DB_CONNECTION_PROPERTIES="Server=example.redshift.amazonaws.com;Port=123;Database=db1";DATABASE=db1; USER=a;AUTHENTICATION_MODE=DBMS"

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.TOC.TOCKMLFeatureViewModel
member.summary:
The base class for all KML features in the TOC.
This class has a strong reference to a native IKMLFeature. Normally this pattern is frowned upon in Pro, but the native KMLFeature COM object is designed to be thread-neutral, so this is OK. This class's Dispose() implementation releases the reference, and the KMLFeature has a normal, ref-counted lifetime.
The threads we use in the Pro UI (the main thread, and the main worker thread) are STA, so calls into the native KMLFeature (which is MTA) do require COM marshaling, in addition to the usual interop marshaling. If this proves to be a bottleneck, we should batch up the chatty interop calls.

member.summary: TOC view models are disposable so that they can release model object references that would keep the view model alive as long as the model itself (through event subscriptions). Since many TOC items can be created per model while the app is running, we want them reclaimed deterministically.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.TOC.TOCItemViewModel.TOCControlViewModel
member.summary: A reference to the TOC control that owns this item. This property is never null.
member.remarks: Even when the map TOC is hosted inside of the layout TOC, this property will be non-null. The control will be owned by the MapView inside the map frame, and the TOCMapViewModel will be re-parented by the map frame's node.

members.member:
Declares an item a match and ensures that it's visible in the tree by expanding its parents.
ensureChildrenAreVisible - flag set to true by default ensuring the item's children are visible too.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.TOCActiveMapViewProviderPaneSettings
member.summary:
Class to manage the active map pane id for the TOCActiveMapViewProviderPane panes.
This id are used when the TOCActiveMapViewProviderPane is initialized and its target map pane has not been initialized and is not ready to find its map view.
This is the case for LayoutPanes. So if a TOCActiveMapViewProviderPane and a LayoutPane are saved with a project, this ids can be used to associate the panes and keep from closing Permanent TOCActiveMapViewProviderPane panes.

member.summary: Exports a map to file.
member.param: Catalog path to map. The map path is only used when the viewerID = -1.

The viewer id of the map pane that will export the map. When the viewerID = -1, the mapPath is used to find any viewers that contain the map path. If one it found then it will be used to export. If no map viewer for the current map path is found, then a new viewer is created for the map path.
Path to the output file.
The Export type.
Dots per inch X.
Dots per inch Y.
XML for the map's floor filter settings.

member.summary: Recompute levels by applying multiplier to statistics already stored in the layer.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.CoordinateSystemsControl
member.summary: The CoordinateSystemsControl is a configurable control that provides a UI for Spatial Reference selection.
member.remarks: Optionally bind a CoordinateSystemControlProperties instance to the CoordinateSystemsControl to provide the desired configuration. A map, spatial reference, and show-vertical-coordinate-systems flag can be set. Developers can bind to the SelectedSpatialReference dependency property to receive selected spatial reference changed notifications and/or use a callback with the SelectedSpatialReferenceChanged event.

member.summary: InitializeComponent

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.CoordinateSystemsControlProperties
member.summary: Configures the properties to be used to initialize the CoordinateSystemsControl
member.remarks: To refresh the CoordinateSystemsControl (eg the map's layers change), provide an updated CoordinateSystemsControlProperties

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.CoordinateSystemsControlProperties.#ctor
member.summary: Construct a CoordinateSystemsControlProperties to configure the CoordinateSystemsControl. Use the Map, SpatialReference (or Wkid or Wkt), and ShowVerticalCoordinateSystems properties to configure the control. They are all optional.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.CoordinateSystemsControlProperties.Map
member.summary: Gets and sets the map whose layers will be used to populate the 'Layers' leaf in the CoordinateSystemsControl.
member.remarks: Map is optional. The default is null. If a map is set then its layers will populate the Layers leaf node in the CoordinateSystemsControl otherwise no layers are shown.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.CoordinateSystemsControlProperties.SpatialReference
member.summary: Gets and sets the spatial reference to be used to select the SpatialReference in the CoordinateSystemsControl.
member.remarks:
SpatialReference is optional. The default is null. If the SpatialReference is set it will be selected in the CoordinateSystemsControl.
Note: only one of: o SpatialReference
o Wkid
o Wkt
need be set.
If the SpatialReference is set, Wkid and Wkt are ignored. If the SpatialReference is null, then Wkid is used. If the Wkid is 0 (or less), then the Wkt is used.
If no SpatialReference is set then the first SpatialReference of the first layer in the provided map is selected. If no map is provided then no SpatialReference is selected.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.CoordinateSystemsControlProperties.Wkid
member.summary: Gets and sets the spatial reference wkid to be used to select the SpatialReference in the CoordinateSystemsControl.
member.remarks:
SpatialReference wkid is optional. The default is 0. If the SpatialReference wkid is set then the corresponding SpatialReference with that wkid will be selected in the CoordinateSystemsControl.
Note: only one of: o SpatialReference
o Wkid
o Wkt
need be set.
If the SpatialReference is set, Wkid and Wkt are ignored. If the SpatialReference is null, then Wkid is used. If the Wkid is 0 (or less), then the Wkt is used.
If no SpatialReference is set then the first SpatialReference of the first layer in the provided map is selected. If no map is provided then no SpatialReference is selected.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.CoordinateSystemsControlProperties.Wkt
member.summary: Gets and sets the spatial reference wkt to be used to select the SpatialReference in the CoordinateSystemsControl.
member.remarks:
SpatialReference wkt is optional. The default is "" (or empty string). If the SpatialReference wkt is set then the corresponding SpatialReference with that wkt will be selected in the CoordinateSystemsControl.
Note: only one of: o SpatialReference
o Wkid
o Wkt
need be set.
If the SpatialReference is set, Wkid and Wkt are ignored. If the SpatialReference is null, then Wkid is used. If the Wkid is 0 (or less), then the Wkt is used.
If no SpatialReference is set then the first SpatialReference of the first layer in the provided map is selected. If no map is provided then no SpatialReference is selected.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.CoordinateSystemsControlProperties.ShowVerticalCoordinateSystems
member.summary: Gets and sets the ShowVerticalCoordinateSystems setting. If this is set to true, the VerticalCoordinateSystems leaf node is shown in the CoordinateSystemsControl UI
member.remarks: The default is false. When false the ProjectedCoordinateSystems and GeographicCoordinateSystems leaf nodes are shown and not the VerticalCoordinateSystems node.

member.returns: A CoordinateSystemPickerProperties

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationInfo
member.summary: Define the transformation information used to populate each row of the table within the TransformationsControl. All the properties within the TransformationInfo are optional.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationInfo.SourceSpatialReference
member.summary: Gets and sets the source spatial reference to be used for the TransformationInfo object (used to populate a table row).
member.remarks:
SourceSpatialReference is optional. The default is null.
Note: only one of:
o SourceSpatialReference
o SourceWkid, and SourceVcsWkid if applicable
o SourceWkt, and SourceVcsWkt if applicable
needs be set.
If the SourceSpatialReference is set, the Wkids and Wkts are ignored. If the SourceSpatialReference is null, then the Wkids are used. If the Wkids are 0 (or less), then the Wkts are used.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationInfo.SourceWkid
member.summary: Gets and sets the source spatial reference wkid to be used to select the SourceSpatialReference for the TransformationInfo object (used to populate a table row).
member.remarks:
The SourceWkid is optional. The default is 0. The SourceVcsWkid should also be defined if a vertical coordinate system needs to be selected.
If the SourceWkid (and the SourceVcsWkid if applicable) is set, then the corresponding SourceSpatialReference with that wkid (and vcsWkid) will be selected for the TransformationInfo object.
Note: only one of:
o SourceSpatialReference
o SourceWkid, and SourceVcsWkid if applicable
o SourceWkt, and SourceVcsWkt if applicable
need be set.
If the SourceSpatialReference is set, Wkids and Wkts are ignored. If the SourceSpatialReference is null, then Wkids are used. If the Wkids are 0 (or less), then the Wkts are used.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationInfo.SourceVcsWkid
member.summary: Gets and sets the vertical coordinate system wkid to be used to select the source spatial reference for the TransformationInfo object (used to populate a table row).
member.remarks:
The SourceVcsWkid is optional. The default is 0. The SourceWkid should also be defined if a SourceVcsWkid is defined.
If the SourceWkid and the SourceVcsWkid are set, then the corresponding SourceSpatialReference with that wkid and vcsWkid will be selected for the TransformationInfo object.
Note: only one of:
o SourceSpatialReference
o SourceWkid, and SourceVcsWkid if applicable
o SourceWkt, and SourceVcsWkt if applicable
need be set.
If the SourceSpatialReference is set, Wkids and Wkts are ignored. If the SourceSpatialReference is null, then Wkids are used. If the Wkids are 0 (or less), then the Wkts are used.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationInfo.SourceWkt
member.summary: Gets and sets the source spatial reference wkt to be used to select the SourceSpatialReference for the TransformationInfo object (used to populate a table row).
member.remarks:
The SourceWkt is optional. The default is null. The SourceVcsWkt should also be defined if a vertical coordinate system needs to be selected.
If the SourceWkt (and the SourceVcsWkt if applicable) is set, then the corresponding SourceSpatialReference with that wkt (and vcsWkt) will be selected for the TransformationInfo object.
Note: only one of:
o SourceSpatialReference
o SourceWkid, and SourceVcsWkid if applicable
o SourceWkt, and SourceVcsWkt if applicable
need be set.
If the SourceSpatialReference is set, Wkids and Wkts are ignored. If the SourceSpatialReference is null, then Wkids are used. If the Wkids are 0 (or less), then the Wkts are used.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationInfo.SourceVcsWkt
member.summary: Gets and sets the vertical coordinate system wkt to be used to select the source spatial reference for the TransformationInfo object (used to populate a table row).
member.remarks:
The SourceVcsWkt is optional. The default is null. The SourceWkt should also be defined if a SourceVcsWkt is defined.
If the SourceWkt and the SourceVcsWkt are set, then the corresponding SourceSpatialReference with that wkt and vcsWkt will be selected for the TransformationInfo object.
Note: only one of:
o SourceSpatialReference
o SourceWkid, and SourceVcsWkid if applicable
o SourceWkt, and SourceVcsWkt if applicable
need be set.
If the SourceSpatialReference is set, Wkids and Wkts are ignored. If the SourceSpatialReference is null, then Wkids are used. If the Wkids are 0 (or less), then the Wkts are used.

member.remarks:
TargetSpatialReference is optional. The default is null.
Note: only one of:

needs be set.
If the TargetSpatialReference is set, the Wkids and Wkts are ignored. If the TargetSpatialReference is null, then the Wkids are used. If the Wkids are 0 (or less), then the Wkts are used.

member.summary: Gets and sets the target spatial reference wkid to be used to select the TargetSpatialReference for the TransformationInfo object (used to populate a table row).

Note: only one of:

need be set.
If the TargetSpatialReference is set, Wkids and Wkts are ignored. If the TargetSpatialReference is null, then Wkids are used. If the Wkids are 0 (or less), then the Wkts are used.

member.summary: Gets and sets the vertical coordinate system wkid to be used to select the target spatial reference for the TransformationInfo object (used to populate a table row).

If the TargetWkid and the TargetVcsWkid are set, then the corresponding TargetSpatialReference with that wkid and vcsWkid will be selected for the TransformationInfo object.
Note: only one of:
o TargetSpatialReference

need be set.
If the TargetSpatialReference is set, Wkids and Wkts are ignored. If the TargetSpatialReference is null, then Wkids are used. If the Wkids are 0 (or less), then the Wkts are used.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationInfo.TargetWkt
member.summary: Gets and sets the target spatial reference wkt to be used to select the TargetSpatialReference for the TransformationInfo object (used to populate a table row).
member.remarks:
The TargetWkt is optional. The default is null. The TargetVcsWkt should also be defined if a vertical coordinate system needs to be selected.
If the TargetWkt (and the TargetVcsWkt if applicable) is set, then the corresponding TargetSpatialReference with that wkt (and vcsWkt) will be selected for the TransformationInfo object.
Note: only one of:
o TargetSpatialReference
o TargetWkid, and TargetVcsWkid if applicable
o TargetWkt, and TargetVcsWkt if applicable
need be set.
If the TargetSpatialReference is set, Wkids and Wkts are ignored. If the TargetSpatialReference is null, then Wkids are used. If the Wkids are 0 (or less), then the Wkts are used.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationInfo.TargetVcsWkt
member.summary: Gets and sets the vertical coordinate system wkt to be used to select the target spatial reference for the TransformationInfo object (used to populate a table row).
member.remarks:
The TargetVcsWkt is optional. The default is null. The TargetWkt should also be defined if a TargetVcsWkt is defined.
If the TargetWkt and the TargetVcsWkt are set, then the corresponding TargetSpatialReference with that wkt and vcsWkt will be selected for the TransformationInfo object.
Note: only one of:
o TargetSpatialReference
o TargetWkid, and TargetVcsWkid if applicable
o TargetWkt, and TargetVcsWkt if applicable
need be set.
If the TargetSpatialReference is set, Wkids and Wkts are ignored. If the TargetSpatialReference is null, then Wkids are used. If the Wkids are 0 (or less), then the Wkts are used.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationInfo.TransformationName
member.summary: Gets and sets the name of the transformation to select for the TransformationInfo object (used to populate a table row), for example "WGS_1984_(ITRF00)_To_NAD_1983".
member.remarks: This is optional. The default is null (no selection). If the TransformationName is set, the source spatial reference and the target spatial reference should be defined too (through SpatialRefence objects, WKT/VcsWkt pairs, or Wkid/VcsWkid pairs). Those spatial references will be used to determine if we are looking for a 2D or a 3D transformation. If those spatial references are not provided, the logic will look for a 2D transformation by default.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationInfo.SpatialFilter
member.summary: Gets and sets the spatial filter. If specified, the SpatialFilter will be used to filter the available transformations for the given source and target spatial reference (which can initially not be defined).
member.remarks: This is optional. The spatial filter can be defined in any spatial reference. It will be projected to the source spatial reference if needed. This property will override any SpatialFilter defined on the TransformationsControlProperties object. If no spatial filter is set on both the TransformationInfo object and the TransformationsControlProperties object, all the possible transformations for a given source and target coordinate system pair will be returned.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationsControlProperties
member.summary: Configures the properties to be used to initialize the TransformationsControl
member.remarks: To refresh the TransformationsControl, provide an updated TransformationsControlProperties

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationsControlProperties.#ctor
member.summary: Construct a TransformationsControlProperties to configure the TransformationsControl. Use the different properties to configure the control. They are all optional.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationsControlProperties.ShowColumnNames
member.summary: Gets and sets if column names should be displayed or not.
member.remarks: The default is true.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationsControlProperties.SourceCoordinateSystemColumnName
member.summary: Gets and sets the column name for the source coordinate system column.
member.remarks: This is optional.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationsControlProperties.TargetCoordinateSystemColumnName
member.summary: Gets and sets the column name for the target coordinate system column.
member.remarks: This is optional.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationsControlProperties.TransformationColumnName
member.summary: Gets and sets the column name for the transformation column.
member.remarks: This is optional.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationsControlProperties.Title
member.summary: Gets and sets the title for the table. This is used by screen reader technologies to announce the name of the table. It is not used in the user interface.
member.remarks: This is optional.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationsControlProperties.CanEditTransformationCollection
member.summary: Gets and sets if items can be added to the table (through the Add button) or removed from the table (through the Delete button for each row) in the TransformationsControl.
member.remarks: The default is true.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationsControlProperties.CanEditCoordinateSystems
member.summary: Gets and sets if the source coordinate systems and the target coordinate systems can be changed in the table. If set to true, buttons will appear next to the source and target coordinate system names for each row. These buttons will launch a coordinate system picker when clicked on.
member.remarks: The default is true.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationsControlProperties.SpatialFilter
member.summary: Gets and sets the spatial filter. If specified, the SpatialFilter will be used to filter the available transformations for all source and target coordinate system pairs in the table. If not specified, all the possible transformations for a given source and target coordinate system pair will be returned. Additionaly, if a SpatialFilter is also defined on a given TransformationInfo object, it will override this property (for this specific TransformationInfo object).
member.remarks: This is optional. The spatial filter can be defined in any spatial reference. It will be projected to the source spatial reference of each TransformationInfo object if needed.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationsControlProperties.TransformationsInfo
member.summary: Gets and sets the transformation information used to populate the table within the TransformationsControl. Each TransformationInfo object will be used to populate one row of the table.
member.remarks: This is optional. This is not updated by the control, the SelectedTransformationNames property defined on the TransformationsControl should be used to retrieve the selected transformations.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationsControlProperties.ShowNoTransformationsMessage
member.summary: Gets and sets if a message (customizable with the property) is displayed or not when the transformation table within the TransformationsControl is empty.
member.remarks: The default is true.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationsControlProperties.NoTransformationsMessage
member.summary: Gets and sets the custom message to diplay when the transformation table within the TransformationsControl is empty.
member.remarks: This is optional. The ShowNoTransformationsMessage property controls if the message is displayed or not when the transformation table within the TransformationsControl is empty.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.TransformationsControlProperties.ShowWarningForEmptyTransformationSelection
member.summary: Gets and sets if a warning message is displayed if there is no initial selection for a transformation element.
member.remarks: The default is false. There will be no initial selection for a transformation element if a TransformationName is not set for a given TransformationInfo object, or if the transformation is not found.

member.summary: For use by third party developers when using the in a custom dockpane in an add-in.

See the Geocode sample in the ArcGIS Pro SDK community samples.

When false the will maintain a weak delegate reference to the subscriber. Using a weak delegate reference relieves the subscriber from the need to unsubscribe to enable proper garbage collection.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.MapControl.AddOverlay(ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.Geometry,ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMSymbolReference)
member.summary: Add an overlay graphic to the map control.
member.param: The geometry of the overlay.
The symbol to use for the overlay.
member.returns: An object that when disposed will remove the overlay.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.MapControl.AddOverlay(ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.Geometry,ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMSymbolReference,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Add an overlay graphic to the map control.
member.param: The geometry of the overlay.
The symbol to use for the overlay.
Map reference scale or -1

Visibility factor for showing the overlay through other objects when obscured in 3D.
Valid range is [0..1], any other value will be treated as 0 (not visible).
member.remarks: When the referenceScale is not equal to -1, the overlay will be created in real world units relative to the provided map reference scale (referenceScale). Otherwise, the overlay will be created in units of points. This is only supported in 2D.
member.returns: An object that when disposed will remove the overlay.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.MapControl.AddOverlay(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGraphic,System.Double)
member.summary: Add an overlay graphic to the map control.
member.param: The graphic to be added to the overlay.
Map reference scale or -1
member.remarks: When the referenceScale is not equal to -1, the overlay will be created in real world units relative to the provided map reference scale (referenceScale). Otherwise, the overlay will be created in units of points. This is only supported in 2D.
member.returns: An object that when disposed will remove the overlay.

member.returns: An object that when disposed will remove the overlay.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.ColorPickerControl.ForceEyeDropperToolToHideProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets if the Eye Dropper tool option is to hide.
member.remarks:
The color picker must be hosted on a non-modal dialog such as a dockpane in order for the Eye Dropper tool to be able to be used. Set this property to true when you are specifically wanting to hide the Eye Dropper tool on the color picker; for example on your own custom ProWindow that is displayed in a modal fashion.
Note, the application may hide the Eye Dropper tool by default in some scenarios. For example the tool will not be visible if the color picker is on a propertySheet.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.ColorPickerControl.ForceEyeDropperToolToHide
member.summary: Gets or sets if the eye dropper tool option is to hide.
member.remarks:
The color picker must be hosted on a non-modal dialog such as a dockpane in order for the Eye Dropper tool to be able to be used. Set this property to true when you are specifically wanting to hide the Eye Dropper tool on the color picker; for example on your own custom ProWindow that is displayed in a modal fashion.
Note, the application may hide the Eye Dropper tool by default in some scenarios. For example the tool will not be visible if the color picker is on a propertySheet.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.SymbolPickerControl.ShowOptionsDropDownProperty
member.summary: Gets and sets whether to show the options burger button on the control.
member.remarks:
Use the options burger button menu to provide picker view options and grouping options for the results
If the options burger button menu is shown _and_ the and/or dependency properties are used then changes to the bindings are not reflected on the options menu. In other words, viewing and grouping options should either be via the UI or programmatically via the bindings but not both.
The default is false

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Controls.QueryBuilderControl
member.summary: The QueryBuilderControl is a configurable control that provides a UI for building a query expression against a layer or table.
member.remarks: Bind a QueryBuilderControlProperties instance to the QueryBuilderControl to provide the desired configuration. A mapMember (layer or table) must be set. An optional Expression can also be set. Developers can use a callback with the ExpressionChanged event to receive expression changed notifications. The ValidateExpression method is also available to validate the current query expression.

member.summary: Activate the locator. Calls SetActivate on the underlying dockpaneview model
member.param: True if the locator is being activated. False if it is being deactivated
member.returns: Task

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Geocoding.LocatorManager.GetLocatorInformationAsync
member.summary: Gets a snapshot of the current locator provider information.
member.returns: A Task of list of objects.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Geocoding.LocatorManager.AddLocatorAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Add a locator to the set of available locators.
member.param: provider path. Can be a local file (ending in .loc) or a online geocode service.
member.returns: Task of bool indicating success or failure.
member.remarks: Three different types of locators are supported : Local locators - example: D:\\Data\\Geocode\\ACT.loc Locators shared to portal - example: https://portal/server/rest/services/locatorName/GeocodeServer Geocoding services associated with an ArcGIS Server connection "ags" file - example: C:\\path\\my_ags_server\\locatorName.GeocodeServer". Note: the suffix .GeocodeServer is required. "C:\\path\\my_ags_server" is the fullpath (without suffix) to the ags connection file ""C:\\path\\my_ags_server.ags"

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Geocoding.LocatorManager.RemoveLocatorAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified locator.
member.param: provider path.
member.returns: Task.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Geocoding.LocatorManager.MoveLocatorAsync(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reorders the position of a locator. Moves it up or down the provider list.
member.param: the locator to reorder.
the new index of the locator.
member.exception: The index is invalid.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Geocoding.LocatorManager.GeocodeAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform a geocode operation. Geocode results are returned according to the active locator providers.
member.param: The address/location to geocode.
Should the candidate results be displayed on the active map?
Should the map zoom to the first candidate result?
member.remarks: As the method is asynchronous, if multiple Geocodes are executed - one after the other, then a successive Geocode may be initiated before the prior Geocode has completed. In this case, a message box will be shown that must be acknowledged by the user to either cancel or continue the current geocode. Refer to to hide the message box/cancel prompt.
member.returns: Task of List of objects. If no locators can be found then null is returned.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Geocoding.LocatorManager.GeocodeAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform a geocode operation. Geocode results are returned according to the active locator providers.
member.param: The address/location to geocode.
Should the candidate results be displayed on the active map?
Should the map zoom to the first candidate result?
Set to true to show a cancelable message box
member.remarks: If showCancelPrompt is set to true then, if GeocodeAsync is called when a previous geocode has not completed, a message box prompt asking the user if they wish to cancel the current (i.e. "previous") geocode will be shown that must be acknowledged. If showCancelPrompt is set to false no message box is shown.
member.returns: Task of List of objects. If no locators can be found then null is returned.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Geocoding.LocatorManager.ReverseGeocodeAsync(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Perform a reverse geocode operation. The results are displayed in a popup.
member.param: the x coordinate of the location in map coordinates.
the y coordinate of the location in map coordinates.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.TrayButton
member.summary: Represents a button that can be added to the ArcGIS Pro Tray.

remarks.para: This base class can be used to create buttons that appear in the tray area of every and . It provides virtual methods that can be overriden to perform actions during the life cycle of this button.

Specify the type of desired button by setting within either an overridden constructor or . After Initialize has been invoked, the underlying UI Button will be fixed for the lifetime of the associated view.
If ButtonType has been set to then should also be set - it will be invoked whenever the UI button is clicked.
If ButtonType has been set to then will be invoked whenever the UI button's Checked state is changed.

If ButtonType has been set to then will be invoked whenever the UI button's Checked state is changed. In addition, a customizable popup window will be displayed whenever the mouse is hovered over the button. Override to provide the content that will be displayed in the popup.
To add to the tray of a MapView, add a TrayButton component to the "esri_mapping_MapTrayButtons" category within DAML.
To add to the tray of a LayoutView, add a TrayButton component to the "esri_layouts_LayoutTrayButtons" category within DAML.

example.para: A sample UpdateCategory needs to be presented here.
Here is a copy of the Snapping InsertCategory.
example.code: <insertCategory id="esri_mapping_MapTrayButtons"> <component id="esri_mapping_SnappingTrayButton" className="ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.Controls.SnappingControl.SnappingTrayButton"> <content L_name="Snapping" largeImage="pack://application:,,,/ArcGIS.Desktop.Resources;component/Images/ContentsWindowListBySnapping32.png" smallImage="pack://application:,,,/ArcGIS.Desktop.Resources;component/Images/ContentsWindowListBySnapping16.png" L_tooltipHeading="Snapping" L_tooltip="Turn snapping on or off for interactive tools." /> </component> </insertCategory>

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.TrayButton.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Invoked when the enclosing View is closed and disposed.

remarks.para: Override this to ensure proper disposal of instance resources - it will be invoked only once.
If the parameter isDisposing is true, then an override should dispose all managed and unmanaged objects.
Otherwise, if isDisposing is false, then an override should dispose unmanaged objects only - because it is being called as part of the instance Finalizer.

member.param: A value indicating, if true, that Dispose is being called from and if false, that Dispose is being called from the instance Finalizer

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.TrayButton.SmallImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the SmallImage property of this .

remarks.para: "smallImage" is a required property within the DAML definition of a TrayButton, and is normally expected to be an icon URI.
SmallImage is used to display an icon for the TrayButton.

After a TrayButton has been constructed, SmallImage may optionally be changed to another icon URI or ImageSource, Such changes should be made within or at a later point, once the DAML properties have been loaded.
If you've changed SmallImage in your code, you can restore the DAML icon by setting it to null.
A PropertyChangedEvent will be signaled when SmallImage is changed, but not when the initial DAML setting occurs.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.TrayButton.HelpURI
member.summary: Gets the DAML helpURI property of this .

remarks.para: This is an optional property.
It is used only if is
When this property is set and non-null, a Help button will be displayed in the popup header, and when clicked, opens the URI within the default browser.
If null (the default value) then the Help button will not be displayed.
Upon initially reading this DAML property, the URI string will be validated as an Absolute URI. If validation fails, then the help URI will be ignored, and no help button will be displayed.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.TrayButton.IsVisibleOnView
member.summary: Gets whether or not this TrayButton is visible in the tray for the current

remarks.para: A TrayButton implementation can determine visibility based on the type of view within the current pane.
The tray will use this property at certain times, to determine if this TrayButton should be visible.
For a Map pane, this is a straightforward process - IsVisibleOnView will be called after the Pane is loaded.
For a Layout pane, IsVisibleOnView will also be called any time that a MapFrame is activated or deactivated.

member.returns: True (the default) this TrayButton should be displayed. False, this TrayButton should be hidden

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.TrayButton.IsChecked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not this is Checked.

remarks.para: Only available if is either or
The underlying UI ToggleButton has its Checked state bound to IsChecked.
When overridden code or the UI button changes the value of IsChecked, then will be invoked.
Normally the UI changes the value of IsChecked, and you can set some corresponding external state within the OnButtonChecked callback.
When changes occur within the corresponding external state, you may want to update the UI Button's appearance only, using instead of directly setting IsChecked.

member.returns: True if the toggle button is checked, false otherwise.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.TrayButton.ClickCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets an associated Command that is invoked whenever the corresponding UI Button is clicked.

remarks.para: Only available if is
This property should be set in the overridden constructor or method.

member.returns: A RelayCommand that will be invoked when the UI button is clicked.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.TrayButton.CanAutoClose
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not a Popup can automatically close when user moves the mouse outside the bounds of the popup.

remarks.para: Only available if is
Just before the popup is opened, is preset to the default value true, meaning that the popup automatically closes when a user moves the mouse outside the bounds of the popup.
Subclasses can set this property to the value false, after the popup has been opened in order to suppress the auto-closing behavior.

This might be important if a control within the popup displays another popup, an end user clicks in that popup, leading to the mouse leaving the bounds of the tray button popup. In this scenario, subclass must be careful to set to false when the popup opens, and reset to true once the popup closes.

An example of where this behavior is necessary is, a tray button popup contains a ComboBox with drop-down popup. When a user activates the drop-down, it is possible for the drop-down to extend beyond the boundary of the tray popup. After user clicks in the ComboBox drop-down, the mouse may now be outside the tray popup boundary and, without using this property to prevent it, the tray code will assume that user wants the popup closed. Subclass code should ensure that is set to false just after the ComboBox popup has been opened, and set to true just after the ComboBox popup has been closed.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.DeviceLocation.MapDeviceLocationOptions.DeviceLocationVisibility
member.summary: Gets and sets the the device location visibility on the map view.

remarks.para: By default DeviceLocationVisibility is set to True.

The location is represented on the map view as a blue circle. This symbol cannot be changed. When location accuracy is poor i.e. the value is higher than the , the location symbology will switch to a red circle.
When direction/heading is available from the open device location source, a white arrow representing the direction/heading of the location will be shown in the middle of the (blue or red) circle.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.DeviceLocation.MapDeviceLocationService
member.summary: The Map Device Location Service will interact with the active map using the current open device location source, such as a GPS/GNSS device.
member.remarks:
The MapDeviceLocationService is a singleton. To access the service use its property. Once connected, the service allows you to zoom or pan to the current location received from your device. Use the service to show/hide the location, adjust the accuracy buffer on the map, interactively Zoom or pan the current map view, and adjust how the map view responds to the current device location. The map view can either be kept centered on the location or rotated to "track" the location always keeping the location heading orientated to the top of the screen. Refer to
To connect to a location device refer to

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.ExportFormat
member.summary: Provides a base set of properties that all export formats inherit.

remarks.para: When exporting a MapView, the size of the output image is based on the Resolution and the Height and Width properties. For example, if the output resolution is 96 and height and width are both 960 then the output image size will be 960 pixels by 960 pixels and 10 inches by 10 inches. The geographic area for an exported MapView is generated based on its location which represents the center of the view.

When exporting a Layout or a MapFrame, the height and width are obtained from the size of the object in page units and the Height and Width properties are ignored. For example, if a MapFrame is 5 inches by 5 inches and the resolution is 300, the output image will be 1500 pixels by 1500 pixels and remain 5 inches by 5 inches.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.ExportFormat.Heading
member.summary: Gets or sets the caption

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.ExportFormat.OutputFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the path and file name for the output export file.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.ExportFormat.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution of the export file in dots per inch (DPI).
member.remarks: (The default value is 96)

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.ExportFormat.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of pixels that represents the width of the output file.

remarks.para: This property only applies to exporting map views. The value is ignored when exporting layouts or map frames.
(The default value is 960)

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.ExportFormat.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of pixels that represents the height of the output file.

remarks.para: This property only applies to exporting map views. The value is ignored when exporting layouts or map frames.
(The default value is 960)
